text:
Hello everyone, I just wanted to get some tips on cold emailing and how to make it better. Currently I have average of 55% open rates and 3% reply rates in USA (b2b SaaS space). I just started as SDR for my mid-sized company few months ago. Here is my cold email toolbox.

Bouncer - I use Bouncer to verify all the emails before sending. The accuracy rate is around a 98%.

Cliently- I use Cliently to send all the emails for myself and some of my client accounts. The best part is that I am able to manage all my email accounts at one place. So instead of opening/managing various tabs/browsers, I just do everything at one place including replying to emails (so not forwarding emails to one address) and I currently do outreach from 4 emails.

Gsuite - I use Gsuite for all the cold email campaigns I run. Also I buy one domain from one workspace and have 2-3 emails associated with each. Keep some in reserves, since some 20-30% burn.

Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo and Salesql - I use Linkedin to find target audience. For high ticket prospects, I use Zoominfo since it is more targeted but expensive.  Sales Navigator is decent for me. Salesql is very affordable and has 60% accuracy on emails. I got 30% off on black friday deal.

Gmass or Warmupinbox - I use these tools for email warmup. Go with default settings. Gmass is free and Warmupinbox is 10 dollars a month. Anything better here?

Hyperise, Nureply, Lyne - For personalization in Videos and Images. Plus few personalized AI written lines (comenting about their linkedin or website)

Is there anything else, I should be doing? Or any way I can make my outreach better?

text:
What are your sequences/campaigns like?

How are your emails written?

Are you testing content?

Related to that, what metric are you optimizing for?

elements.text:
What are your sequences/campaigns like?

How are your emails written?

Are you testing content?

Related to that, what metric are you optimizing for?

text:
Yeah I’d be curious what metric your optimizing for as well. 

I didn't see anything in there about how you make sure the emails are being sent to interested buyers and contain info they’d actually want to read/respond to.

We open and mark every single cold email as spam and block them. After chatting with some peers at other companies, apparently we aren't the only ones.

elements.text: Yeah I’d be curious what metric your optimizing for as well.
I didn't see anything in there about how you make sure the emails are being sent to interested buyers and contain info they’d actually want to read/respond to.
We open and mark every single cold email as spam and block them. After chatting with some peers at other companies, apparently we aren't the only ones.
